channel.title: Windows, Mac, and Linux Testers needed!
channel.description:
I've finally got cross compiling to work for Mac, Linux, and Windows all from my Linux box, it only took me a few days... :(
Anyhow, please download this: http://www.moparisthebest.com/downloads/test_cross/test1.7z
and run the command 'java Test' in that directory. This should start up a torrent client downloading a perfectly legal torrent (ubuntu iso) (obviously you don't need to complete the download, I'd like to know it starts though). I'd like you to post what it prints out above and below the torrent client here, mine says this: [code]OS Name: linux OS Architecture: amd64 OS Version: 2.6.32-26-generic cwd: /home/mopar/tests executing: /home/mopar/tests/client_test.linux.x86 magnet:?xt=urn:btih:bcf2e587afd4d3b1bdd8ece5150d9fb4d2958af4&dn=ubuntu+desktop+10.10+i386&tr=http%3A%2F%2Fdenis.stalker.h3q.com%3A6969%2Fannounce[/code] [code]OS Name: mac os x OS Architecture: ppc OS Version: 10.4.11 cwd: /Volumes/WORKGROUP;MYTORRENTFLUX/tests executing: /Volumes/WORKGROUP;MYTORRENTFLUX/tests/client_test.osx.ppc magnet:?xt=urn:btih:bcf2e587afd4d3b1bdd8ece5150d9fb4d2958af4&dn=ubuntu+desktop+10.10+i386&tr=http%3A%2F%2Fdenis.stalker.h3q.com%3A6969%2Fannounce[/code] [code]OS Name: mac os x OS Architecture: i386 OS Version: 10.5.8 cwd: /Volumes/downloads/tests executing: /Volumes/downloads/tests/client_test.osx.i386 magnet:?xt=urn:btih:bcf2e587afd4d3b1bdd8ece5150d9fb4d2958af4&dn=ubuntu+desktop+10.10+i386&tr=http%3A%2F%2Fdenis.stalker.h3q.com%3A6969%2Fannounce[/code] [code]OS Name: windows xp OS Architecture: x86 OS Version: 5.1 cwd: C:\Documents and Settings\moparisthebest\My Documents\Downloads\test1 executing: C:\Documents and Settings\moparisthebest\My Documents\Downloads\test1 /client_test.win32.exe magnet:?xt=urn:btih:bcf2e587afd4d3b1bdd8ece5150d9fb4d2958 af4&dn=ubuntu+desktop+10.10+i386&tr=http%3A%2F%2Fdenis.stalker.h3q.com%3A6969%2F announce[/code] [code]OS Name: windows vista OS Architecture: x86 OS Version: 6.1 cwd: C:\Users\mopar\Downloads\test1 executing: C:\Users\mopar\Downloads\test1/client_test.win32.exe magnet:?xt=urn:b tih:bcf2e587afd4d3b1bdd8ece5150d9fb4d2958af4&dn=ubuntu+desktop+10.10+i386&tr=htt p%3A%2F%2Fdenis.stalker.h3q.com%3A6969%2Fannounce[/code]
If, for some reason, the java program won't run, post the error, and try to run the correct binary file for your setup like so: [code]client_test "magnet:?xt=urn:btih:bcf2e587afd4d3b1bdd8ece5150d9fb4d2958af4&dn=ubuntu+desktop+10.10+i386&tr=http%3A%2F%2Fdenis.stalker.h3q.com%3A6969%2Fannounce"[/code]
This current 'client_test' app runs pretty bad this way, and I'm going to write one that is better for controlling through java with machine readable output and such, but I just need to know these binaries work first. :)
That's about it, I really appreciate the help!

item.title: Windows, Mac, and Linux Testers needed!
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

OS Name: linux
OS Architecture: i386
OS Version: 2.6.36-ARCH
cwd: /home/fc/rubbish
executing: /home/fc/rubbish/client_test.linux.x86 magnet:?xt=urn:btih:bcf2e587afd4d3b1bdd8ece5150d9fb4d2958af4&dn=ubuntu+desktop+10.10+i386&tr=http%3A%2F%2Fdenis.stalker.h3q.com%3A6969%2Fannounce

and it started downloading…

====== ubuntu desktop 10.10 i386 ======
[/quote]Not using 10.04 LTS… Dumbass.

That’s the name of the torrent being downloaded, now who is the dumbass?
[/quote]The point is dumbass, that he is on 10.10 instead of 10.04[/quote]

No, the point is you can’t read that 10.10 is the torrent being downloaded, not the operating system of the user.

item.title: Windows, Mac, and Linux Testers needed!
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Great to see it works on 64-bit java on windows too.

Now why does 32-bit java running on 64-bit windows 7 say it is windows vista, but 64-bit java on the same OS says it is windows 7. Vista had 64-bit as well, right? That sure is odd.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows, Mac, and Linux Testers needed!
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Great Rix_, thanks.

Alright, I’ve tested it on all of my operating systems and it seems to work fine. Funny to note that the ‘vista’ one is actually 64-bit windows 7, running 32-bit java for some reason.

I’d still appreciate it if others tested, who knows what libraries and such I’ve installed on my computer over the years. I need to see if they work for everyone.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows, Mac, and Linux Testers needed!
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I’ve finally got cross compiling to work for Mac, Linux, and Windows all from my Linux box, it only took me a few days…

Anyhow, please download this:
http://www.moparisthebest.com/downloads/test_cross/test1.7z

and run the command ‘java Test’ in that directory. This should start up a torrent client downloading a perfectly legal torrent (ubuntu iso) (obviously you don’t need to complete the download, I’d like to know it starts though). I’d like you to post what it prints out above and below the torrent client here, mine says this:

OS Name: linux OS Architecture: amd64 OS Version: 2.6.32-26-generic cwd: /home/mopar/tests executing: /home/mopar/tests/client_test.linux.x86 magnet:?xt=urn:btih:bcf2e587afd4d3b1bdd8ece5150d9fb4d2958af4&dn=ubuntu+desktop+10.10+i386&tr=http%3A%2F%2Fdenis.stalker.h3q.com%3A6969%2Fannounce

OS Name: mac os x OS Architecture: ppc OS Version: 10.4.11 cwd: /Volumes/WORKGROUP;MYTORRENTFLUX/tests executing: /Volumes/WORKGROUP;MYTORRENTFLUX/tests/client_test.osx.ppc magnet:?xt=urn:btih:bcf2e587afd4d3b1bdd8ece5150d9fb4d2958af4&dn=ubuntu+desktop+10.10+i386&tr=http%3A%2F%2Fdenis.stalker.h3q.com%3A6969%2Fannounce

OS Name: mac os x OS Architecture: i386 OS Version: 10.5.8 cwd: /Volumes/downloads/tests executing: /Volumes/downloads/tests/client_test.osx.i386 magnet:?xt=urn:btih:bcf2e587afd4d3b1bdd8ece5150d9fb4d2958af4&dn=ubuntu+desktop+10.10+i386&tr=http%3A%2F%2Fdenis.stalker.h3q.com%3A6969%2Fannounce

OS Name: windows xp OS Architecture: x86 OS Version: 5.1 cwd: C:\Documents and Settings\moparisthebest\My Documents\Downloads\test1 executing: C:\Documents and Settings\moparisthebest\My Documents\Downloads\test1 /client_test.win32.exe magnet:?xt=urn:btih:bcf2e587afd4d3b1bdd8ece5150d9fb4d2958 af4&dn=ubuntu+desktop+10.10+i386&tr=http%3A%2F%2Fdenis.stalker.h3q.com%3A6969%2F announce

OS Name: windows vista OS Architecture: x86 OS Version: 6.1 cwd: C:\Users\mopar\Downloads\test1 executing: C:\Users\mopar\Downloads\test1/client_test.win32.exe magnet:?xt=urn:b tih:bcf2e587afd4d3b1bdd8ece5150d9fb4d2958af4&dn=ubuntu+desktop+10.10+i386&tr=htt p%3A%2F%2Fdenis.stalker.h3q.com%3A6969%2Fannounce

If, for some reason, the java program won’t run, post the error, and try to run the correct binary file for your setup like so:

client_test "magnet:?xt=urn:btih:bcf2e587afd4d3b1bdd8ece5150d9fb4d2958af4&dn=ubuntu+desktop+10.10+i386&tr=http%3A%2F%2Fdenis.stalker.h3q.com%3A6969%2Fannounce"

This current ‘client_test’ app runs pretty bad this way, and I’m going to write one that is better for controlling through java with machine readable output and such, but I just need to know these binaries work first.

That’s about it, I really appreciate the help!

Read full topic
item.source: Windows, Mac, and Linux Testers needed!
